meanings.sent1: I heard the tocks of the clock as it struck midnight.
meanings.sent2: The tocks of the metronome kept the musicians in perfect time.
meanings.sent3: The tocks of the old grandfather clock always made me feel nostalgic.
meanings.sent4: The tocks of the clock echoed through the empty house, a reminder of the passing hours.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic tocks of the clock lulled me to sleep.

meanings.definition: A sound made by a clock or similar device.
meanings.sent1: The tocks of the clock were soothing in the quiet room.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the gentle tocks of the alarm clock.
meanings.sent3: The tocks of the clock seemed to mock me as I struggled to wake up on time.
meanings.sent4: The tocks of the clock were like a heartbeat, marking the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The tocks of the clock filled the room with a sense of urgency.

meanings.definition: The back part of a person's body, specifically the buttocks.
meanings.sent1: The baby giggled as I tickled their tocks.
meanings.sent2: She sat on her tocks to rest after a long walk.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail and wiggled its tocks in excitement.
meanings.sent4: He slipped on the wet floor and landed right on his tocks.
meanings.sent5: The tocks of the toddler waddled as they tried to keep up with their siblings.
